publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2226# Mr David Davidson: The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism-That the Parliament notes the continuing success of the Edinburgh Military Tattoo; congratulates Brigadier Melville Jameson CBE, Chief Executive and Producer of the Edinburgh Military Tattoo, and his staff for a record breaking season which was viewed by 100 million people world-wide and generated £50 million for the Scottish economy, and wishes success for the special Tattoo to mark the Queen's Golden Jubilee in 2002.
S1M-2226# The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism (lodged on 18 September 2001) Mr Keith Raffan*

S1M-2226# Mr David Davidson: The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism-That the Parliament notes the continuing success of the Edinburgh Military Tattoo; congratulates Brigadier Melville Jameson CBE, Chief Executive and Producer of the Edinburgh Military Tattoo, and his staff for a record breaking season which was viewed by 100 million people world-wide and generated £50 million for the Scottish economy, and wishes success for the special Tattoo to mark the Queen's Golden Jubilee in 2002 Supported by: Mr Keith Raffan
S1M-2226# The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism (lodged on 18 September 2001) John Scott*

S1M-2226# The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism (lodged on 18 September 2001) Bill Aitken*, Margaret Smith*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Murdo Fraser*, Mr Murray Tosh*, David Mundell*
S1M-2226# The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism (lodged on 18 September 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Nora Radcliffe*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-2226# Mr David Davidson: The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism-That the Parliament notes the continuing success of the Edinburgh Military Tattoo; congratulates Brigadier Melville Jameson CBE, Chief Executive and Producer of the Edinburgh Military Tattoo, and his staff for a record breaking season which was viewed by 100 million people world-wide and generated £50 million for the Scottish economy, and wishes success for the special Tattoo to mark the Queen's Golden Jubilee in 2002 Supported by: Mr Keith Raffan, John Scott, Bill Aitken, Margaret Smith, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Dr Winnie Ewing, Murdo Fraser, Mr Murray Tosh, David Mundell, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Nora Radcliffe, Phil Gallie, Mr Brian Monteith
S1M-2226# The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism (lodged on 18 September 2001) Brian Adam*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S1M-2226# The Edinburgh Military Tattoo and its Contribution to Scottish Culture and Tourism (lodged on 18 September 2001) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
